section.title: Purpose
section.p: The Multimedia Protocols RTP (Real-Time Transport Protocol) component provides RTP communication services. This overview shows the usage of the RTP/RTCP protocol as defined in RFC 3550.

section.title: Required background
section.p: The clients that make use of this API need to be familiar with RFC 3550 standard.

section.title: Key concepts
section.p: The component has the following key concepts:

dd.p: RTP provides end-to-end network transport services for data with real-time characteristics, such as interactive audio and video. It is built on top of the User Datagram Protocol (UDP).
RTP contains two closely linked parts:

li.p: RTP: Real-Time Transport Protocol to carry data that has real-time properties.
RTCP: RTP Control Protocol to provide feedback on the quality of service being provided by RTP.

dd.p: RTP Control Protocol used to provide feedback on the quality of service being provided by RTP. RTP and RTCP support transmission of the data and the control packets.

section.title: Architectural Relationship
section.p: The RTP component of MM-protocols uses the following:

section.title: API summary
section.p: The following are some of the main classes used for RTP communication.

entry.p: A handle to an RTP session that abstracts all RTP information going to and from an RTP socket, and its corresponding RTCP data.
A handle to an RTP packet used to access the packet through the interface provided by this handle.
Derived from RRtpPacket and used as a handle to an RTP send packet.
Derived from RRtpPacket and used as a handle to an RTP receive packet.
A handle to a receive stream. An object of this type represents the stream of data on a single SSRC and delivers the RTP packets and RTCP information in the order they arrive.
A handle to a send stream, used to manage the creation and sending of packets.

section.p: The following diagram shows the RTP classes and their relationships.

section.title: Typical uses
section.p: Any application requiring RTP as its transport protocol should use this API. RTP provides the following key services:

section.p: Note: Before using any of these services, a connection to the socket server must have been made and the socket must be open.
